instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> brain dead
threads.message:
I'm working on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board which got damaged by coffee spill. It had corrossion around <CHIP>U3700</CHIP>/<CHIP>U3770</CHIP>/<CHIP>U2890</CHIP>/<CHIP>U3900</CHIP>/<RESISTOR>R5640</RESISTOR>/<CHIP>U8210</CHIP> (pictures attached).

I have cleaned it up, replaced <CHIP>U3770</CHIP> and <CHIP>U2890</CHIP>, repaired broken traces, replaced damaged resistors/caps. Also resoldered <CHIP>U3700</CHIP> and <CHIP>U8210</CHIP>. Area of <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> and <RESISTOR>R5640</RESISTOR> looks good after celaning.

- board starts, switch to 20v and takes ~0,45-0,80A.
- CPU gets warm, CPU VCORE is 0,945v constantly, doesn't drop to 0,6v.
- <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 13,05v.
- there is no image on internal screen, nor on external monitor with internal screen unplugged
- no USB activity
- trackpad clicks
- no CAPSLOCK light when pressed
- fan is spinning fot ~20s and stops

I have tried clean ME bios from forum and board behaves the same. Dead CPU/PCH?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> brain dead
threads.message:
There is more damage caused by liquid spill.
Leakage from backlight output (40-50V) to data lines can easy destroy the CPU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> brain dead
threads.message: I have inspected LCD flex cable and connector both on motherboard and LCD sides and there are no signs of liquid. I can't see any data lines on corroded are going straight to CPU. Even though it's possible, that CPU died?
